oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Carolina Hayride - 1945-01-06 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of the January 6, 1945 broadcast of the Carolina Hayride originating from WBT, Charlotte, NC; as recorded by a San Francisco radio station. Featuring announcer Howard Turner, master of ceremonies and producer 'Charlie Briarhopper' (Charles Crutchfield), and performers Fred Kirby, the Briarhoppers (including Hank Warren and 'Big' Bill Davis), the Southland Jubilee Singers (including Oscar Broadway), Arthur "Guitar Boogie" Smith (very likely, unconfirmed), and the Tennessee Ramblers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Fred Kirby; Briarhoppers; Southland Jubilee Singers; Arthur "Guitar Boogie" Smith; Tennessee Ramblers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: The Hand Is Writing On The Wall (Fred Kirby) -- Charlie Briarhopper introduces the Briarhoppers -- New River Train (Briarhoppers) -- Charlie Briarhopper introduces the Southland Jubilee Singers -- Lead Me To That Rock (Southland Jubilee Singers) -- Carpool P.S.A. (Charlie Briarhopper) -- Old Grey Mare (parody) -- After You've Gone (Arthur "Guitar Boogie" Smith [unconfirmed]) -- Charlie Briarhopper talks -- Little Liza Jane (Briarhoppers) -- Charlie Briarhopper introduces the Tennessee Ramblers -- Standing Outside Of Heaven (Tennessee Ramblers) -- Closing statement (Charlie Briarhopper) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Howard Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; WBT (Radio station : Charlotte, N.C.); Carolina hayride (Radio program); Kirby, Fred; Briarhoppers (Musical group); Tennessee Ramblers (Musical group); Smith, Arthur, 1921-2014; Broadway, Oscar; Southland Jubilee Singers; Crutchfield, Charles Harvey, 1912-1998; Turner, Howard Arthur, 1919-1992
